skillTree.localised_description: Gnoblars take part in may obscure and dangerous sports; among the most popular of these is "squig jousting". Two Gnoblars sit across from each other on the backs of squigs and charge at each other in an attempt to unseat their opponents.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Rule number one of being a leader is to be far more terrifying than the next braggard who thinks they ought to take your place.
It is not enough to impose military defeat upon the foe, they must be brought to their knees through punitive taxationâ€¦ unless they'd rather get in the meat-pot instead?
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Step 1: Grease up your Gnoblars! Step 2: Go faster!
You have to watch 'em, as there's no telling what malicious schemes those wickedly cunning Gnoblars might enact.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A smart Head Honcho knows when the fight is going against him. And it's not like he cares about the other Gnoblars much, anyway

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing a Gnoblar has learned from Ogres, it's that bigga is betta... especially when it comes to the size of your tool
Tiefstones attract magic, ye see? And magic that hits a tiefstone goes places other than the Honcho holding it
Gnoblar leaders like to wear large helms and hats, symbolizing their status and authority. This one is covered with spikes, horns, and tokens of good luck
The best way to win a fight is to be winning a fight.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Smart Gnoblars grab bits of metal and wood and tie it to their bodies. It makes em harda.

effects.description:
Armour: +3 for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some Head Honchos train their Gnoblars. Makes em know when to stab

skillTree.localised_description: Survive enough fights, and sometimes a Gnoblar learns how to fight back

Melee Defence: +2 for all Gnoblar units

Melee Defence: +4 for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +6 for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Runnin' from Ogres is good training for runnin' from other enemies

Speed: +5% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No matter how many Gnoblars die, there's always more of the little buggers

effects.description:
Replenishment: +3% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Replenishment: +6% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Replenishment: +9% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The brightest of the Gnoblars know that they never have to get into melee combat. They can just chuck sharp things from a safe distance

effects.description:
Missile Strength: +3% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +6% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +9% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Where there's a weak point, there's a Gnoblar with a sharp stick.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +3% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +6% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +9% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When a Rhinox is slain in battle, its horns are sawn off from its dead carcass, hollowed out, and turn into instruments of war
There's so many damn Gnoblars, they're always somewhere you don't expect them to be

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: No matter how many Gnoblars you think you've seen, there's always more

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing when to dodge an opponent's attack is a skill a Gnoblar learns very early in life. Or it becomes food.

effects.description:
Physical Resist: +10% for all Gnoblar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every Gnoblar knows, as long as the enemy can't reach you, you're safe.

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: When a Rhinox is slain in battle, its horns are sawn off from its dead carcass, hollowed out, and turn into instruments of war. And if the horn is really big, when played it makes all the Gnoblars just a little bit excited
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
One can never go hungry on a long march for as long as there are captives for the meat-pot.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Butchery is an art. This one knows how to extract every last morsel worth eating from a carcass, leaving only bones behind them.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Though they risk killing the Ogres directly behind them, those fighters who like it spicy can propel themselves further with gassy emanations following a hearty meal.
The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."
